shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction - Mäqdǝmä Wängel “Introduction to the Gospels” (fols. 3ra-8vb), including discourses “On the 72 Disciples” (fols. 3ra-3rb) and “On the Episcopal Sees” (fol. 3rb); Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 7vc-8rb); The “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 8va-8vb) - Canon tables (fols. 9r-10v) - On the Reliability of the Gospels (fols. 11ra-11rc) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 11rc-59vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fols. 11rc-11vc) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 12ra-59vb) - Postscript (fols. 59vb) III) Gospel of Mark (fols.60ra-87va) - Biography of Mark (fols. 60ra-60rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fols. 60rb-60vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 61ra-87rb) - Postscript (fols. 87rb-87va) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 87va-131rb) - Biography of Luke (fols. 87va-87vb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 88ra-131rb) - Postscript (fol. 131rb) V) Gospel of John (fols.131va-163vb) - Biography of John (fols. 131va-131vb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 132ra-163va) - Postscript (fols. 163va-163vb)
Additiones 1-5.

donors.donor: ʾIyasu (s. supplication formulas in fols. 59vb, 88r); ʾAqbä Mikaʾel, written by a secondary, later hand (s. supplication formula fol. 61r).

dcomments.dcomment: The name ʾIyasu may refer to King ʾIyasu II (r. 1730-55) or King ʾIyasu III (r. 1784-88).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been resewn. The leather cove is torn off from the spine.

mslits.mslit: Ms. previously unknown. See S. ANCEL, "Discourse against Catholic Doctrine in Tǝgray (Ethiopia): A Nineteenth Century Text", Aethiopica 15, 2012, 93-104.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (the spine is torn off); textile (red) inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover is poorly visible (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, double crescent, double sine wave with dots, cross hatching, small x).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine folds of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex.

squires.squire: I(2/fols. 1r-2v) – II(9; s.l.1, stub after 9/fols. 3r-11v) – III(8/fols. 12r-19v) – IV(10/fols. 20r-29v) – V(10/fols. 30r-39v) – VI(10/fols. 40r-49v) – VII(10; s.l. 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 50r-59v) – VIII(10/fols. 60r-69v) – IX(8/fols. 70r-77v) – X(10; s.l. 2, stub after 9; 9, stub after 2/fols. 78r-87v) – XI(10/fols. 88r-97v) – XII(10/fols. 98r-107v) – XIII(10/fols. 108r-117v) – XIV(10/fols. 118r-127v) – XV(4; s.l.1, stub after 4; 2, stub after 4/fols. 128r-131v) – XVI(10; s.l.3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 132r-141v) – XVII(10; s.l.4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4/fols. 142r-151v) – XVIII(10/fols. 152r-161v) – XIX(3/fols. 162r-164v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (fols. 3ra-9vc, 11ra-11vc). 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (fols. 12ra-163vb). Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the introduction and the canon tables.

margin.info: All data are for the second page of the first Gospel, recto side (fol. 13r).

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (fols. 3ra-9vc, 11ra-11vc). 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C (fols. 12ra-163vb). Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the introduction and the canon tables.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Mid or second half of 18th century

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donor; names of the Evangelists written in the margins; groups of lines on the incipit page of each text; incipit of sections of Text I and of each chapter of Texts II-V; the word mǝʿǝraf and chapter numbers; numbers of the “tituli”; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

additional.cont: Fol. 1r: Traditional genealogy (?).
additional.det: Crudely written, partly unintelligible (a pen trial?).

additional.cont: Fols. 1va-2vb: Short theological treatise entitled Haymanotä ʾabaw qäddämt “The Faith of Ancient Fathers”, written by ʾabba Gäbrä Ḥǝywät.
additional.det: Written by a later, 19th- or early 20th-century hand. See S. ANCEL, "Discourse against Catholic Doctrine in Tegray (Ethiopia): A Nineteenth Century Text", Aethiopica 15, 2012, 93-104.

additional.cont: Fol. 163vb: Donation note.
additional.add: Fol. 163vb, l.4: ናሁ፡ ወሀብነ፡ ዘንተ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ንሕነ፡ ኵልነ፡ <...>ተ፡ እምነ፡ ማርያም፡ ድንግል፡ ወላተ[sic]፡ አምላክ፡ ዘቤተ፡ እግዚእ፨ ጸወነ፡ ነዳያን፡ ወምስካየ፡ ግፉዓን፡ ሶበ፡ አደመነ፡ ቃለ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ከመ፡ ይትመሀሩ፡ ቦቱ፡ ካህናቲሃ፡ ሌዋውያን፨ ወይእዜኒ፡ ባርኩ፡ ሊተ፡ አምኃነ፡ ወበሉ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት፡ ወሰላመ፡ ገብርኤል፡ መልአክ፨ ዘሤጦ፡ ወዘተሣየጦ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ከመ፡ አርዮስ፡ ረሲዕ፡ ወከመ፡ ሴሞን፡ መሠርይ፨ በሥልጣነ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፨ ወበአፈ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ወበሥልጣና፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወሊተኒ፡ ለኃጥእ፡ ጸሐፊሃ፡ ኃጥእ፡ <በእደ>፡ ማርያም፡ ኢትርሥኡኒ፡
additional.det: The names of the donors, after the word "all of us" were erased, and are unreadable. The note is written by the same hand as the main text, by the scribe who mentiones himself by name, with the first word erased, but still readable, <Bäʾǝdä> Maryam.

additional.cont: Fol. 164r: List of the honey tributes from the district of Säbäya Maryam.
additional.add:
Fol. 164r, l.1: የሰበያ፡ የማር፡ ግብር፡ የ[sic]

የግእተሎ፡ ፩ቁና፡ ተኩል

የአረጊት፡ ፩ቁና፡ ተኩል

የአዴ፡ ትሻአተ፡ ፩ቁና፡ ተኩል

የብላላ፡ አጐላሌ፡ ፩ቁና፡ ተኩል

የመቲአ፡ ፩ቁና፡ ተኩል

የአገር፡ አሎከማ፡ ፩ቁና፡ ተኩል

የሰበያ፡ መአር፡ የኸው፡ ነው

ሲሶ፡ የማርያም፡ ነው፡ ፪እጅ፡ የንጉሥ፡ ነው፡ ድምሩ፡ የማርያ[om. ም]፡ ፭ቁና፡ የንጉሥ፡ ፲ቁና

የሰበያ፡ የማር፡ ግብር፡የግእተሎ፡ ፪ቁና፡ ተኩል

የአረጊት፡ ፪ቁና፡ ተኩል

የአዴ፡ ትሻአተ፡ ፪ቁና፡ ተኩል

የብላላ፡ አጐላሌ፡ ፪ቁና፡ ተኩል

የመቲአ፡ ፪ቁና፡ ተኩል

የአገር፡ አሎከማ፡ ፪ቁና፡ ተኩል

የማርያም፡ ሲሶ፡ ፭ቁና፡ የንጉስ፡ ሁለት፡ እጅ፡ ፲ቁና

extras.extra: - Running titles written in red, in the upper margin of the fols. - Fol. 88ra: a secondary, partly unintelligible note mentions wäyzaro (here spelled: wäğaro) Wälättä Sǝmʿon and ʾabeto ʾAsäffa or ʾAsru [?], possibly referring to their commemoration day.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner: fols. 12r: ፩; 20r: ፪; 30r: ፫; 40r: ፬; 50r: ፭; 60r: ፮; 70r: ፯; 78r: ፰; 88r: ፱; 98r: ፲; 108r: ፲፩; 118r: ፲፪; 128r: ፲፫; 132: ፲፬; 142: ፲፭ (faded); 152: ፲፮ (faded).

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - A red thread is inserted in the right upper corner of fol. 160.
